Name: "Heset"-vase in terracotta
Description: This terracotta receptacle dates to the Middle Kingdom and is a beautiful example of a heset-vase. The stopper has a different inventory number and actually belongs to a different receptacle of the same type. The heset-vase was used to pour water libations during purification ceremonies, particularly onto funerary offering tables. The piece was discovered at El-Haraga at the entrance to the Faiyum.
